bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of Salfest S. Sylvester for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Comes now the Respondent, Stener S. Wenaas, and for return to the Writ of habeas corpus issued herein states, that he admits that the said petitioner is now in his custody and control, but denies that the said petitioner is now in his custody and control, but denies that the custody and control of said Petitioner by this respondent is in any manner illegal and unlawful, but alleges the fact to be that his custody abd control is in accordance with the laws of the State of Washington, and of the United States.
Respondent further states that during the summer and fall of 1898 the petitioner was in the employ as the agent of the Equitable Life Assurance Society, which is a corporation, and as the agent of said Company While said Petitioner who in trail Court, until Dakota received into his possession certain money and property of said Company amounting to several hundred dollars, which sums he then and there unlawfully and feloniously embezzled and converted to his own use.
Respondent further shows that thereafter the said petitioner in order to avoid the laws of the State of North Dakota fled therefrom and became a fugitive from justice of said state and thereafter took refuge in the State of Washington.
Respondent further showeth that subsequent thereto the Governor of the State of North Dakota made due demand on the Governor of the State of Washington, which demand was accompanied by a requisition and other papers pursuant to law, demanding that the Governor of the State of Washingtion deliver over to the authorities of the State of North Dakota the said Petitioner as a fugitive from justice of the State of North Dakota as aforesaid; that the Governor of the State of North Dakota duly appointed this respondent, Stener S. Wenaas, as the agent
of said state to receive said petitioner on said requisition proceedings.
Respondent further showeth that said requisition as issued by the Governor of the state of North Dakota, together with the various and diverse papers thereunto attached was by this respondent delivered to the Governor of the State of Washington on or about the 26th day of December, A. D. 1898; That pursuant to the laws of the United States and of the State of Washington, and by virtue of the requisiton and demand as made upon him by His Excellency the Governor of the State of North Dakota, His Excellency, the Governor of the State of Washington, did on the 26th day of December, A. D. 1898 under his hand and the Seal of the State issue his certain Governor's warrant directing this respondent as the agent of the State of North Dakota to arrest said petitioner and convey him from this state to said State of North Dakota. That this respondent holds custody of the said petitioner under and by virtue of said warrant as aforesaid, a copy of which is hereto attached marked Exhibit A. and made a part hereof.
Respondent further shows that he denies each and every allegation contained in the petition of petitioner herein, except such as may he herein admitted, which are inconsistent with or in opposition to the statements and allegations in this return made.
Respondent further shows that heretofore and on or about the 28th day of December, A. D. 1898, the said petitioner appealed to the Superior Court of King County for a Writ of Habeas Corpus alleging that his distraints of liberty was at that time unlawful and that he was then unlawfully in the custody of this respondent; that to said proceedings this respondent made due and regular return; that the Superior Court on the trial and hearing of said matter coming up on the appliation of defendant, the present petitioner, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and on respondent's return thereto, a open that the said respondend having said petitioner in his custody under and by virtue of the Governor's warrant, a copy of which is hereto attached marked Exhibit A., was in all things lawful and correct and in conformity to the laws of the State of Washington and of the United States.
-2-
That thereafter the said Petitioner in the Superior Court of King County appealed from said determination of the Superior Court to the Supreme Court of the State of Washington, and such proceedings were thereafter hadin the Supreme Court of the State of Washington in said cause that said last named court did on June 20th, 1899, render its judgment and opinion that the custody of the said petitioner was lawful, and affirmed the judgment of the Superior Court of King County to that effect directing that said petitioner be at once delivered to this respondent in conformity with the extradition proceedings and the warrant of the Governor of the State of Washington.
That thereafter the Remittitur from the Supreme Court of this state, together with the opinion of said court, was duly filed in the Clerk's office of King County, the original remittitur and the certified copy of the opinion of the Supreme Court of the State of Washington is now and here produced and exhibited in court. A copy of the opinion of he Supreme Court herein tx. B" a
Stener S. Wenaas
Jas F M Elroy Attorney for Respondent.
STATE OF WASHINGTON County of King.
ss
Stener S. Wenaas being first duly sworn, upon oath deposes and says: I am one of the respondents in the above entitled matter; as such I make the foregoing return and that the facts and statements set forth in the foregoing returns are true.
Stener S Wenaas
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th day of June, 1899.
Na D. Futton Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
